Top Definition. farooq. Arabic for 'just', literally 'he who uses the Criterion (al-Furqan) to distinguish between what is right and what is wrong', Farooq is a common Muslim male given name.

Faruq redirects here. For the village in Iran, see Faruq, Iran. Farooq (also transliterated as Farouk, Farook, Faruk, Faroeq, Faruq, or Farouq; Arabic: فاروق ‎, Fārūq) is a common Arabic given and family name derived from an honorific of Umar, an early Muslim leader. Al-Farooq literally means, the one who distinguishes between right and wrong.

Meaning of Farooq. Indian name. In Indian, the name Farooq means-derived from faruq, moral.The name Farooq originated as an Indian name. The name Farooq is most often used as a boy name or male name. Indian Name Meaning-derived from faruq, moral. Origin-India.

Farooq /fa-rooq/ [2 sylls.] as a boys' name. Farooq's name origin is Arabic, and Farooq means distinguisher, judge. Farooq is an alternate form of Farouk (Arabic): the last king of Egypt. Farooqui is a familiar surname. Farooq has 2 variants: Faruq and Faruqh. Farooq is a rare given name for men but a very popular last name for both adults and children (#24350 out of 150436, Top 16%).
